header.title: Positano to Capri – Ferry
header.description: Follow these steps to walk from Hostel Brikette to Positano’s port, buy your ferry tickets, and board for Capri. Includes practical timing and operator tips.

journeyOverview.title: Journey overview
paragraphs: Ferries between Positano and Capri run most frequently from spring to early autumn and may be cancelled in rough seas. Travel time is typically 30–60 minutes depending on operator and vessel.

toPort.title: Walk to Positano’s port
steps: Exit the hostel via the main door.
Go down the stairs to the road, turn left, and walk just over 100 m (≈330 ft).
At the first junction (point 1), turn right by the Tabacchi (first building on the right).
Continue downhill; at the first switchback (point 2), leave the road and take the stairs straight ahead.
At the bottom of the stairs, reach the road (point 3); cross and continue straight onto the next stairs.
When those stairs end at the road, cross over, turn left, walk ~10 m (≈30 ft) to point 4.
Turn right off the road and follow the stairs downhill.
At the bottom, turn right to reach point 5, then continue under the archway on the right.
The port (Spiaggia Grande pier) is about 50 m (≈160 ft) ahead on the right-hand side of the beach.

tickets.title: Buy tickets and board
tips: At the port each ferry operator has its own booth.
The sign beside the booth shows the next departure for that operator.
Buy tickets directly from the operator. Arrive 20–30 minutes early to exchange any vouchers and queue.
After purchasing, walk to the end of the pier and wait for boarding to begin.

arrival.title: On arrival in Capri
paragraphs: Disembark at Capri’s tourist port (Marina Grande). Follow signs for the funicular, taxis, or buses depending on your plans. In high season, lines can be long — buying return tickets in advance can help on busy weekends.
For your return to Positano, check late-afternoon sailings and weather advisories. If ferries are cancelled, consider postponing your return or travelling via Sorrento the following day.
